ok: after several several hours i got ubuntu installed
took about 5 hours to get windows to let me defragment the drive... it wouldnt let me do it without running chkdsk /f... which refused to run
how do i make it synchronize
it says i need to run NTP support
is the time correct in windows?
oh fun.  Lemme see -- it's a timezone problem, then?
i.e. the time is off by a few hours?
oh, ok.  You probably want to install the "ntpdate" package
ntpdate will run automatically at boot time to sync the time to the ubuntu ntp server.  That is assuming that networking is going ok
if you want to run it RIGHT NOW!, you need to run "sudo ntpdate <ntp server>"
at the risk of being a heretic, I use (oh, I forget now) time.windows.com as my ntp server
uid=1000 = all files on this partition are made to look like they're owned by the user with the ID of 1000
